Finally, we‚Äôll leverage the federal government‚Äôs investments in drug research. 1 in 4 new drugs are rooted in this publicly supported research. When this research is sold to drug developers, we'll mandate that any resulting drug will be given a ‚Äúvalue-based‚Äù price.

Part of how drug companies keep prices high is through layering on extra patents. We‚Äôll limit each new drug to a single patent lasting 20 years and work with Congress to stop brand-name drug makers from slowing the introduction of generics.

We‚Äôll force drug companies to function like any other market and compete on the price and value of their medicines, rather than the amount of money they pay for preferential treatment. We‚Äôll do away with all drug-company payments to pharmacy benefit managers.

We‚Äôll keep drug spending in check by capping Medicare beneficiaries‚Äô out-of-pocket drug spending at $2,000 annually. We‚Äôll also redesign the benefit to make insurers and drug companies shoulder more of the cost. https://t.co/kkkqAWDZme
